ns2:testcase.ns3:title: R1onR2regr:FS-LON-001/PSA-LON-014-014/The system must have the Average Balance, the Highest Balance and the Lowest Balance in the Loan account for the Calendar Month/ Positive
ns2:testcase.ns3:description:
The highest, lowest, and average loan outstanding balances at the end of the month must be stamped on the loan account. These values must be for the calendar month. These balances must be displayed on the Month-Wise Statistics screen, found by going to the Loan Account / Other Inquiry screen and selecting Month-Wise Statistics from the dropdown.
These fields must exist on both LOCs and Term loans.
ns2:testcase.ns3:creator: v071715

tag0:div.tag0:p: Successor Test Case Linkage :Â FS-LON-001/PSA-LON-014-014/The system must have the Average Balance, the Highest Balance and the Lowest Balance Â in the LOC account for the Calendar Month/Positive
Success Criteria : The system has theÂ Average Balance, the Highest Balance and the Lowest Balance in the Loan account for the Calendar Month.

tag0:div.tag0:span: o To be computed and stored month wise.
o Average balance refers only to the Principal Outstanding in any type of account.
o Closing balance on all days to be added and divided by the number of days in a month.
o In case of partial months (i.e., in a month when the loan is booked is say 5th of the month) count only the effective days the account is in the system
â€¢ Highest balance in the account refers to the maximum balance in the given month.Â System to capture the closing balance as well as the date
â€¢ Similarly the lowest balance in the account refers to the minimum balance in the given month.Â System need to capture the closing minimum balance as well as the date.
